jMusicMetaManager.processingstructures

Class Entry

  • java.lang.Object
    • jMusicMetaManager.processingstructures.Entry

  • public class Entry
extends java.lang.Object
    A data structure to hold the name of a key and the indexes in some external data structure that correspond to this key. An Entry is constructed with only one index, but an Entry can later be merged (using the merge method) with another entry that has the same key, and their indexes will be combined.

    Note that it is possible that the value field may be set to null by some calling methods for various reasons.

      • merge

        public void merge(Entry given_entry,
                  boolean use_given_value)
        Adds the indexes of the given Entry object to this Entry object. If the use_given value parameter is true, then the value field of this Entry object is replaced by the value field of the given Entry object.
        Parameters:
        given_entry - The Entry object whose fields are to be merged with this one's.
        use_given_value - Whether or not the given Entry object's value field should replace this one's.

      • mergeIfIdentical

        public boolean mergeIfIdentical(Entry entry)
        Checks the given Entry to see if it has the same value field as this Entry. If it does not, then nothing is done. If both Entry objects have the same value field, then the indexes field of the passed entry are added to the indexes field of this array.

        False is also returned and no change is made if one Entry object has a null value field. A merge is performed and true is returned, however, if both Entry objects have null value fields.

        Parameters:
        entry - The Entry to compare with this Entry, whose indexes may be added to this Entry's indexes if a merge occurs.
        Returns:
        True if both Entry objects have the same value field, false if they differ or if one but not both value fields are null.
